result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Defendant shall give written notice prior to any change in address or telephone number to the Clerk of this Court and Defense Attorney.  Defendant may have NO CONTACT with K.M.C., DOB 04-27-03; M.E.H., DOB 05-28-09; H.A.S., DOB 06-12-02; M.D.S., DOB 06-14-03; E.L.S., DOB 06-30-05.  Defendant may have NO CONTACT with any minors unless in a business or commercial setting.  Defendant may have NO CONTACT with M.M.M., DOB 01-14-10 with the exception that he may have contact with his daughter, M.M.M., DOB 01-14-2014, to correspond with the order of the family court that was entered on August 1, 2016.  Defendant may have contact with C.E.J.M., DOB 03-26-99 with the following restrictions: There shall be no alcohol consumption or on the premises; The current custody and placement order is modified to provide that Deanna Hertlein is granted primary placement of C.E.J.M., DOB 03-26-99; There shall be no mention or conversation between Douglas J. Makovsky and C.E.J.M., DOB 03-26-99, concerning the above cases, nor K.M.C., DOB 04-27-03 the alleged victim in the above cases, nor her mother; There shall be no questions of C.E.J.M., DOB 03-26-99, by Douglas J. Makovsky regarding the activities of Deanna Hertlein or M.M.M., DOB 01-14-10 (Douglas' child and half-sister of C.E.J.M., DOB 03-26-99); C.E.J.M., DOB 03-26-99 has the final say granting permission for any contact with him by Douglas J. Makovsky.

1:30 pm - Defendant Douglas J. Makovsky appeared with attorney Stephen Donald Willett.  Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Parties have received and reviewed PSI. DA certifies victims rights compliance. DA states previous plea agreement.  Comments and recommendation by DA. Comments by Attorney Willett. Further comment by DA regarding restitution.  Comment by DE.  Comments and ruling by Court.  Court provides written explanation of determinate sentence. Is eligible for SAP and CIP. Firearms and voter ineligibility notification stated by Court. DA withdraws motion for bond forfeiture. So noted. Appeal rights given. Adj. 2:14 pm

Court imposes:
Ct. 1 - Deferred entry of judgment for a period of 15 years.  See written order. 

Ct. 3 - 8 year prison term consisting of 4 years initial confinement and 4 years extended supervision with credit for 1 day for time served. 
Conditions:
Sex offender evaluation and follow through with any treatment recommendations
Submit DNA sample and pay surcharge
Register with Sex Offender Registry
Complete treatment as recommended by agent
Restitution for counseling costs of victim not covered by insurance
Court costs
NO CONTACT with juvenile victim with exception of an apology as deemed appropriate by agent

Sentencing hearing at 09-11-2015 01:30 pm

1:49 pm - Defendant Douglas J. Makovsky appeared with attorney Stephen D. Willett.  Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  DA states agreement. DA certifies victims rights compliance.  DA moves to amend Ct. 3 to 940.225(3) - 3rd Degree Sexual Assault.  So ordered. DE pleads NO CONTEST to Cts. 1 & 3.  Court questions DE regarding the plea.  DA explains elements of charge.  Court finds plea/waiver to be free, etc.  Court finds factual basis does exist.  Court accepts plea, finds DE guilty and orders entry of JOC on Ct. 3 and defers entry of judgment on Ct. 1 pending sentencing and pre-sentence investigation and on motion of DA dismisses Cts. 2 & 4. Court orders PSI. Adj. 2:06 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 06-23-2015 01:45 pm
